title: Firefox doesnt open
content:
Hello, I have been using google chrome for the past few years but I have been experiencing some performance issues lately, so I decided to move to Firefox.

I have installed Firefox on my PC and when I try to open it, a white window flashes and then the program shuts down. (It just doesn't open)

Thank you.
creator: pokornyd06

title: Accesso impossibile come abbonato al sito del giornale La Repubblica.
content: Da almeno un mese (probabilmente da Firefox 103.0) non riesco più, come facevo in precedenza, ad accedere come abbonato al sito del giornale La Repubblica. Dopo l'inserimento della password, sembra che ci sia il login ma poi il sito ritorna in versione pubblica. Cordiali saluti Matteo De Nittis

title: probabile virus
content:
Buongiorno, uso firefox da una vita e da qualche giorno, improvvisamente, non riesco più ad entrare nella mia casella di posta (libero.it) poichè vengo reindirizzato alla seguente pagina:

https://trkmyclk.xyz/visit.php?k=11b2e2da8f233babf9ef944bec0f0c00&c=156&bid_id=2440-e95035a3c9801ec-831&pub=mail1.libero.it&exchange=gothamads&ip=217.57.204.0&browser=&os=&ifa=&cc=IT&time=BdjMTY2MTQzNzg5NzYzOQ&browserv=104&site_id=mail1.libero.it_1f8f2961770e&sec_id=6489854407e2a51b0addfb7dacffee9b&xrtb_id=16a78a8b31d24db39b31121f8dfbc678&ifm_ori=2||mail1.libero.it&banner_id=npTKm&a_href_id=SZCQ&scid_bak=1c41d66b534abcb1a...

Il customer care di Libero mi ha suggerito di cancellare cronologia e cookies (cosa che ho fatto) ma il problema si ripresenta: riesco ad utilizzare la posta ad intermittenza (funziona solo una volta su due/tre).

Cosa posso fare?

Grazie.

title: QuickBooks Login Issue on Mozilla Firefox
content: I have been using QuickBooks Desktop Software for a long time. I switched to QuickBooks hosting and tried to access it through Mozilla Firefox. I am getting an error stating, "Account services unavailable, please try back later“. Help with this, please!
creator: jimmy.wick90

title: Cannot log into Godaddy
content:
Godaddy doe not work with Firefox. Since an update from Firefox some 4 / 5 weeks ago, I canno log into my Godaddy account. It works with Google Chrome, Microsoft Edge and everything else apart from Firefox. And yes I have cleared the cache and history and removed the single add on that I had.

Whatever the Firefox update did, it certainly stopped me using Godaddy.

I'm very disappointed, not only with Firefox failing to fix the problem they generated, but also with Firefox's lack of support.
creator: peter616

title: Geolocation issues with mapping services on Firefox Snap
content:
I'm having issues with the geolocation on various mapping services with the Snap version of Firefox Browser on Kubuntu 22.04.

When I press the button to get my precise location on Google Maps, the mapping service just zooms out to the capital city I reside in. On OpenStreetMap, I do get a marker, but its precise location isn't my own but that from a village that is far away from my own (despite still being in the same commune as mine), and it also shows a very large transparent blue radius, which indicates that the location isn't precise at all.

I've tried uninstalling the snap version of Firefox and installing the Flatpak version, and the issue doesn't happen there. However, I want to stick with the Snap version of this browser for compatibility sake, since this is the official version for Kubuntu, according to Canonical.

Does anyone share this issue with the snap version of Firefox? Is there any workarounds I can take in the meanwhile?

Thanks in advance.
creator: earthwormjimx3

title: Youtube videos cant load (tried everything)
content:
So I tried loading a youtube video and it gets stuck loading, I dont know how else to describe it but when I click play, it gets stuck on the buffering/loading icon and does nothing.

I have tried: Scanning my computer for malware Running Firefox in safe mode Refreshing firefox Refreshing the tab Restarting firefox Restarting my computer Disabling my extensions Disabling my proxy connection settings Disabling hardware acceleration
creator: gametek505

title: context menu changes not recognized in userChrome.css
content:
Frequently when I update Firefox something stops working the way I want it to. So after the last update I disabled updates. That was a while ago (version 89) and my browser was getting pretty stale. So I backed everything up, reenabled updates, and now I have version 104.

And, of course, something is broken now. The context menus when I right click are not functioning as before. The userChrome.css is still there in the chrome folder in my profile and has the same contents. The option toolkit.legacyUserProfileCustomizations.stylesheets is set to true. But it doesn't work anymore. I added a line to change the color of the tab toolbar and that worked. So userChrome.css is being read and acted upon. But the other command (I whittled it down to just one additional command for testing) is ignored.

Here is what my userChrome.css looks like right now:

@namespace url("http://www.mozilla.org/keymaster/gatekeeper/there.is.only.xul");

  1. context-openlinkintab { display:none!important; }
  2. TabsToolbar{ background-color: #CCCCCC !important }

But the "Open Link in New Tab" still appears in the context menu when I right click a link. It didn't do this before the upgrade to 104. Did something break in between version 89 and 104 or is it some other oddity?

Any ideas?
creator: penderjohnd

title: Firefox slow on youtube and twitch
content: I am having a strange issue where firefox is slow in youtube and twitch specifically. Every other site works fine. Youtube videos sometimes load fine but then the comment section never loads. When trying to go back to the home page of youtube it sometimes tells me I have no internet connection even though I do. On twitch the home page loads fine and stream previews play fine. As soon as I click on a stream though I just have a black screen with endless loading but I can see the chat activity. I have reset firefox and removed all extensions but have had no luck. I also tried a fresh install of firerfox but still no luck. The issue also still happens in a private window. I tried on chrome and do not have this issue. Any ideas?
creator: g3charlie
